channel.title: Sven Co-op
channel.description:
I'm finding it kind of hard to believe there's so many Half-Life fans here who have never seen/played/heard of the mod 'Sven Co-op'. It's probably the most developed mod for HL1 (bar TFC?) and provides literally 100+ hours of fun. For the past 2 years the mod has been rather... dead, however in the last 6 months they have updated it to the new version (4.0/4.07) which is a VAST improvement. Basically they've overhauled the NPC's (New models/AI/Attacks) and improved upon the weapons with again new models/animations/sounds.
There is a somewhat active mapping community who create some great maps involving objectives/killing enemies all with the help of your friends/randoms Online.
Like I said 100+ hours of fun, keeping your mind off the release of BM. Really, I recommend it.
[url]https://www.svencoop.com/[/url]
Edit: 100+ hours of fun if you played version 3.0 with the large amount of maps.
Did I mention full HL1 main storyline online cooperative with full HD models? :smiley:
If you've already played the mod I'd love to hear some stories or praise from the game ^_^

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: jeffraven
item.description:
Back to the topic, I used to be a huge fan of Sven. I even donated to it, too. Interest fell off as other games came out and even though 4.0 is out I can’t see myself getting excited for it. It really does depend on who you have as your teammates, too.

To those who complained about missing sequences, because of the problems they had with certain sequences that had you go back to previously visited maps, it was impossible to get them to work correctly, so they were cut.

Read full topic

Eric Fong:

You too bleh to understand or i didn’t give enough detail to let you understand? I mean Jack and Grey Acumen are better then me.

Oh stop beating yourself up over it. I mean, look at Madmax and Lolipopkid, their like puppies. No matter how many times you kick them, they’ll keep coming back for more. But you, if people start saying you’re bad at English, you think everybody hates you and that your the lowest of low.

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Raminator:

No, it doesn’t. If something is obtuse, it is (besides being greater than 90°) indistinct or obscure. For example, many of my posts are obtuse.

That doesn’t sound right either. Vague and ambiguous do a better job of expressing that, without the risk of calling many of your own posts intellectually dull or dim-witted.

SC’s objectives can be ambiguous or vague, and the gameplay can be random and indiscriminate. But I can’t find any way to apply “obtuse” to SvenCoop other than when describing its playerbase.

Read full topic

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: Sky_Monster
item.description:
mattemuse:

Are you saying Jack and Grey Acumen are boring and have no friends?

Possibly…

Yes it’s true… 60% of the maps are terrible and only worthy of one playthrough, some not even one glance. The other 40% can be pretty fun though if you play with people you know and trust (and who aren’t retards who consistently block you and steal all the ammo).

Osprey isn’t a bad map… It’s a classic xD

Read full topic

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: Black_Op
item.description:
It’s been some time since I’ve played Sven Co-op, but it is indeed one of the few mods I’ve downloaded and enjoyed.

Read full topic

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
I consider 90 degree angles to be pointer than 120 degree ones.

Sky Monster:

I guess it takes a fun person with friends to play with to enjoy the mod then. :[

Are you saying Jack and Grey Acumen are boring and have no friends?

Read full topic

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Grey Acumen:

well, obtuse is used to refer to wide angles exceeding 90 degrees, and to things that are pointless, or lacking sense.

120-degree angles make perfect sense. I do not see your point.
So instead of calling your definition obtuse, I will call it misguided.

“Obtuse” is mostly dull… I believe what you meant to say was “spawning a random number of enemies in indiscriminate places”, for which I will agree 100% (as to why SvenCoop maps are flawed).

Read full topic

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: MadMax
item.description:
i played it.but the fun heavyly depents on the players.so,some retards(like me) can ruin the fun,or some awesome guys(like me(yes i am syzophren))can make it huge ass fucking fun.

but some maps there just suck(osprey,eg),so,you need a good server with good maps to have fun

Read full topic

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
Raminator:

You keep using that word. I do not think it means what you think it means.

well, obtuse is used to refer to wide angles exceeding 90 degrees, and to things that are pointless, or lacking sense.
I actually think the word is the most fitting one I could have used. It both refers to the lack of thought that i viewed, but also gives a slight nod to the wide variety of enemies placed and where they were placed.

Read full topic

i have been playing this mod for a long time i still paly it it rules especaly the fact that you can add player models insted of replacing player models. sven co-op rules.

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
It’s fun, but the HLSP campaign is pissing me off because they changed so much stuff.
A) I think it would have been better with the original weapon models
B) While the chaingun is epic, I think it would have been better without added/altered weapons
C) How the hell do you finish WGH? They killed that scripted sequence! Do you have to go through the vents or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
I tried it, but between spawning obtuse number of enemies in obtuse places along with the fact that map transitions often skipped sections, killing my frame of reference, compounded by the fact that you couldn’t access any areas unless someone already joined you for multiplayer destroying any chance you had of simply dicking around while waiting for someone to join you, all pretty much shot down any interest I had in it.

Read full topic

item.title: Sven Co-op
item.dc:creator: Jack
item.description:
Played it. Had fun for two hours. Clicked uninstall.

Read full topic
